instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3476 Intermittent backlight
threads.message:
Late 2013 13" 3476 board, backlight goes dim (can see video on LCD with flashlight) after 1-4 hours. Sometimes works fine for days on end. No sign of liquid damage. 

Thoughts? I really don't want this thing on the bench for days on end.

threads.title: 820-3476 Intermittent backlight
threads.message:
Did you have original Magsafe 2 charger?
You need to measure some voltage on the backlight area.
Should be good to test known good LCD assembly first.

threads.title: 820-3476 Intermittent backlight
threads.message:
Yes original charger.
Tested with new LCD, same problem.
Haven't checked backlight circuit voltages, don't want to put time into a potentially unrepairable problem and customer is considering purchasing a new one anyway.

threads.title: 820-3476 Intermittent backlight
threads.message: its definitely repairable, I would suggest you make some measurements when the backlight is not present , so we can first establish a state , Foe example , check for backlight output voltage , that will give you an idea of the circuit state , you should not give up on Backlight repairs, as its almost the easiest

threads.title: 820-3476 Intermittent backlight
threads.message: Bad SMC_LID should block image too, but is good to check it.
